gurmukhi: su soB nwg BUKxM ]Anyk dust dUKxM ]46]
transliteration: Su Sobh Naag Bhookhanan|| Anek Doust Dookhanan||46||
translation: The ornaments of Nagas bedeck his neck. Which have the power of destruction for the tyrants. 46.

transliteration: Kridaan Paan Dhaariooan|| Daror Paap Tdarooan||
translation: He, who wields the sword in his hand, he is the remover of millions of sins.

transliteration: Gadaa Grist Paanian|| Kamaan Baan Taanian||47||
translation: He hath caught hold of the big mace and hath fitted the arrow in his stretched bow.47.

transliteration: Sabad Sankh Bajjian|| Ghanank(i) Ghounghar Gadjian||
translation: There is sound of the blowing conch and jingling of many small bells.

transliteration: Saran Naath Torooan|| Oubaar Laaj Morooan||48||
translation: O Lord, I have come under Thy Refuge, protect my honour.48.

transliteration: Anek Roop Sohooan|| Bisekh Dev Mohooan||
translation: Thou appearest impressive in various forms and gods and are the treasure of the Grace alone.

transliteration: Adev Dev Devalan|| Kridaa Nidhan Kevalan||49||
translation: Thou art the worshipping temple of the demons and gods and are the treasure of the Grace alone . 49.

gurmukhi: su Awid AMq eyikAM ]Dry su rUp AnyikAM ]
transliteration: Su Aadh Ant Ekian|| Ddare Su Roop Anekian||
translation: He remain uniform from the beginning to end and hath adopted various forms.

transliteration: Kridaan Paan Raajaoo|| Bilok Paap Bhaajaoo||50||
translation: The sword appears impressive in his hand, seeing which the sins run away.50.

gurmukhi: AlMkiRqM su dyhXM ]qno mno ik mohXM ]
transliteration: Alankritan Su Dehayan|| Tano Mano Ki Mohayan||
translation: His body is bedecked with ornaments, which allures both body and mind.

transliteration: Kamaan Baan Dhaar-hoo|| Anek Sattru Taar-hoo||51||
translation: The arrow is fitted in the bow, which causes many enemies to flee away.51.
There is the jingling sound of the small bells and a new sound emanates from the anklets.

transliteration: Prajvaal Bijjulan Jvalan|| Pavitra Param Nirmalan||52||
translation: There is light like the blazing fire and lightning, which is highly holy and pure.52.
